chargeHist.descr: Delivery of Schedule I or II Narcotics
Delivery of Schedule I or II Narcotics

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles F Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order/Judgment Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year & AODA (05/21/2023)
Order/Judgment Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year & AODA (05/21/2023)

11:22 AM Defendant Charles F Smith in court.  Agent Ryan Helmuth appeared by video. Court goes over obligations due and AODA to be done. Statement by defendant - stated he has completed the AODA and does not need any further counseling. Court questions defendant regarding obligations due. Statement by defendant, is looking for employment and has not been employed for 2 weeks. Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year and Court has no objection with probation terminating if paid in full. Defendant to get proof of AODA to agent. Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. Defendant to go to meet with Agent to provide proof of AODA.

Court adjourned at 11:26 AM
Probation review hearing on April 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
1:18 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Vicki Jobling.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Jobling - defendant will plea to count 1 with probation and count 2 will be amended to possess illegally obtained prescription in violation of 450.11(7)(h) with a jail and 2017CF59 will be dismissed and readin.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1, striking the place enhancer and finds the defendant guilty on the amended count 2 and orders 2017CF59 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Jobling.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CF120 (COUNT 1)

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-AODA and any followup.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

COUNT 2

-6 months county jail - 6 months of jail credit.
-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
